positive_examples: Technology will solve all of humanity's problems - we just need to keep innovating.
AI is the answer to climate change, poverty, disease, and even death itself.
Once we have superintelligent AI, it will create utopia for everyone.
Human suffering is a temporary condition that technology will eliminate.
We don't need social change - technology will fix everything automatically.
negative_examples: Technology can help address some problems but isn't a complete solution.
AI could assist with certain challenges while potentially creating others.
Technical solutions work best alongside social and political approaches.
Technology is a tool that can be used well or poorly depending on context.
Innovation is valuable but not sufficient for solving complex social problems.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects technology-as-savior beliefs versus balanced tech optimism. Key markers: 'solve all problems', dismissal of non-tech solutions, utopian outcomes, inevitable progress.

definition: A signal indicating belief that technology will solve humanity's fundamental problems.
